citation.article-title: Sporosarcina koreensis sp. nov. and Sporosarcina soli sp. nov., isolated from soil in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sporosarcina soli sp. nov.
Sporosarcina soli (so′li. L. neut. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the organism).
Cells are Gram-positive, aerobic, non-motile, spore-forming rods (0.7–1.0×2.0–3.0 μm) that occur singly or in pairs and occasionally in short chains.
Endospores are round and are positioned centrally in non-swollen sporangia.
Light-orange-coloured colonies are formed after incubation for 2 days on nutrient agar or TSA at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at temperatures ranging from 15 to 37 °C, with optimum growth occurring at 30 °C.
Growth does not occur in the presence of >5 % NaCl.
The pH range for growth is 7.0–9.0, the optimum being pH 8.0; growth is not observed at pH 5.7 or 10.0.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, urease, phenylalanine deamination and nitrate reduction.

Negative for anaerobic growth, formation of indole and dihydroxyacetone, in the Voges–Proskauer test, for acid production from d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-xylose and d-mannitol and for hydrolysis of starch, casein, gelatin and Tween 80.
Does not utilize citrate or propionate.
The peptidoglycan is of the l-Lys–d-Glu type (variation A4α).
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The major polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol and an unidentified phospholipid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 44.5 mol%.
The type strain, I80T (=KACC 11300T =DSM 16920T), was isolated from upland soil in Suwon, Korea.
